website_summaries.verdict: Customers desiring a looser, non-mummy design should check out this warm 4 season-friendly option.
cons: Does not hold up well under machine washing

customer_reviews.title: Great but not for plus size peeps
customer_reviews.text: This really is a 5 star sleeping bag for regular size people. I am "fluffy" at 5'5 and 240 lbs wearing a size 20-22 women's pants and 2xl shirt and this bag does not zip up for me past the top of my thighs. You would need a 36" bag to fit. I did use it on first night camping and it kept my lower body perfectly toasty in 34 degree weather. Keeping 1 of 2 bags purchased since it will be my goal bag to fit into by next fall. Super comfy and plenty of length on the normal size. If the hubby can lose some weight too I will def. reorder.
customer_reviews.author: Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Will Be Using Again
customer_reviews.text: Took this on a trip to Colorado - used it at around 9,500 feet. Daytime was 105 deg nighttime was in the 50's. Perfect for camping - lightweight and easy to carry. Only negatives I have: the "pillow" at the top was a little flat - bring your camp pillow, and it is VERY hard to get back into the little bag - but that is typical of any sleeping bag - they grow. Heading back out to CO for a fall camping trip - looking forward to using this again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: We love these sleeping bags!
customer_reviews.text: We have a project to help homeless people as the weather gets colder. One of the goals is to provide 100 sleeping bags. So if you see alot of these going to Columbus, Ohio, that's why. The project leader chose these sleeping bags for donors to purchase for Project Hope - to assist area homeless people with food, warmth, personal care items, etc. without judgement or requirements. I'll be buying more as part of my monthly commitment to donate to this important project. In other words: We love these sleeping bags!!
customer_reviews.author: Rick F.

customer_reviews.title: Ripped up when washed
customer_reviews.text: Garbage sleeping bag, I washed it once I received it and it fell apart! So annoyed by this!
customer_reviews.author: nina

customer_reviews.title: it was a beautiful day and when night came we were ready for ...
customer_reviews.text: We went camping this past Saturday, it was a beautiful day and when night came we were ready for bed. That night was extremely cold, I believe it was 30 degrees we were literally freezing our butts. I grab the sleeping bag not expecting to make any difference but they kept us warm through the night. The sleeping bags are extremely warm, pretty good size and the material was not to heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Ana Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Compact and affordable
customer_reviews.text: Decent and affordable, works as expected, even has a little hoody.
customer_reviews.author: KEVV

customer_reviews.title: Did a very good job keeping me warm for a good price
customer_reviews.text: I used it on a very cold night on the north rim of the Grand Canyon. Did a very good job keeping me warm for a good price. Only negatives are it unzips on its own when you apply pressure from inside (ie, roll around a bit), it is very hard to put it back into it's bag, and the material near the zipper easily gets caught if you're not very careful zipping up.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Very narrow bag, made for extremely skinny people only! Not even 30 inches of width! Beware!
customer_reviews.text: Although the sleeping bag is nicely made and seems warm, it is extremely narrow, I am an average male, 5'8", 165lbs, 44in chest, I COULD NOT FIT COMFORTABLY INSIDE THIS SLEEPING BAG. It was so tight I could not cross my arms and any movement was very restricted. Virtually useless for an adult male of average size. Maybe a very talk and very skinny lady might be able to fit, my son was ok but he's only 9, 4'8" and weighs about 70lbs. Would love to return this and get a refund and choose a better sleeping bag.
customer_reviews.author: David Chiddo

customer_reviews.title: Not for a grown Man!!!
customer_reviews.text: These sleeping are terrible, they are really only good for temps. above 40 degrees F. I would not recommend them for anyone larger then a Men's medium, I am an extra large and no room for my shoulders to fit in and zip up. I would not waste my money on these bags.
customer_reviews.author: David Caster

customer_reviews.title: Nice sleeping bag.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty decent sleeping bag. Used it on a camping trip with some others. Has been a while since I've been camping and one of the other guys actually ended up buying the same bag which wasn't planned. It is warm and comfortable. I'm 6' 2" and I fit pretty well. It is not for those with wider shoulders though as my friend experienced, it was more of a squeeze for him. Getting it back into the bag wasn't terrible, just have to make sure you get the proper folds then push all the air out.
customer_reviews.author: Troy Young

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't hold up!
customer_reviews.text: The bag ripped on my first attempt to put it back in the bag, so I gave up on the storage bag because it seemed like a decent sleeping bag. I washed it per instructions 3x, and it fell apart on the 3rd. It's now spewing stuffing after 3 uses. I bought a Coleman sleeping bag at the same time; it was the same price but didn't have the built in pillow. It has been used just as much and is near perfect still.
customer_reviews.author: LadyT

customer_reviews.title: Good starter back for the price.  Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Inexpensive sleeping bag for casual camping/hiking. Light and easy to pack in/out. Zipper might cause issues but as long as you're careful you shouldn't have an issue. Used it during windy lower 40s weather and it was comfortable. It was a little narrow in the shoulders for me however I'm 6'2" 200lbs and move around a lot. If you're smaller than me then I recommend this bag for first time campers/hikers.
customer_reviews.author: michael mccarthy

customer_reviews.title: Not warm, not durable
customer_reviews.text: No way is this a twenty degree bag! It didn't even hold up to 45 degrees. Also the zipper broke. It does pack up small and is light for the price but this is a summer bag only.
customer_reviews.author: Delina Storm

customer_reviews.title: Read reviews
customer_reviews.text: I should have paid closer attention to the reviews. I would have been warned that the photo of a person holding the bag in the palm of one hand isn't accurate. Either that's a different bag or they have it in the hand of a giant. Either way, it's not going to fit well in my hiking pack.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: I suspect I know why some people have problems with the zipper. The tag is placed in a really bad location. If you pull hard when opening up the zipper for the first time, it's likely to be caught and you may break the zipper. So either be careful, or just cut off the tag. The sleeping bag is comfortable, long enough to sleep in (I'm 5'10"), but not particularly light or compact. That's pretty normal for a sleeper rated down to 20F.
customer_reviews.author: Engineer D.

customer_reviews.title: while talking about zipping the zipper was not the best. zipper kept sticking
customer_reviews.text: this is clearly not ment for a ADULT man, never less someone that is 6'2. no way to zip close with one arm hanging out, while talking about zipping the zipper was not the best. zipper kept sticking, or getting stuck on something had trouble to zipping up to my hips. it is clearly ment for kids way how little with it gives you. length wise it was good enough to fit me, just not the with
customer_reviews.author: Erik

customer_reviews.title: Kept me warm in cold camping weather
customer_reviews.text: Camped in 32 degree weather with rain and hail and high winds. I was glad I could cocoon inside and pull drawstrings nearly entirely closed over my head. Didn't want to climb out in the morning. For the price, this is a great sleeping bag.
customer_reviews.author: A. Mkva

customer_reviews.title: Affordable, warm, decent size...
customer_reviews.text: This was surprisingly warm. I slept on a mat in my tent and there was no rain so I don't know how it does in water but I would imagine you'd want to avoid getting it wet. I'm 6'0" and I get cold easily. I used this camping towards the end of winter in 40° weather at night (Northern California) and I was toasty warm. I recommend it. This doesn't roll up into something tiny for your backpack. It's fairly large but if you want to throw it into your trunk, it's a great buy. I even bought one for the wife.
customer_reviews.author: tom

customer_reviews.title: Great bag, great company!
customer_reviews.text: Let me start out by saying my 7 and 8 year old boys just started Bushcraft this summer. We sleep in hammocks every time we're out. Last weekend we went up into the Pennsylvania mountains. My 8 year old was using this bag in 41° weather and slept like a baby (that's amazing because he's always cold). I reached out to customer service and they were prompt in replying and friendly, professional, and knowledgeable. This might be a a new company, I don't know. What I do know is they've earned a customer for life. You really won't beat the bag for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth L Pace JR

customer_reviews.title: Thank You
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product to use in a shelter for Hurricane Irma. The sleeping bag was of good quality. It was easy to replace in the carrying case. When we lost electricity (no air condition), I still slept comfortably. Appreciated the amount of material used to make the sleeping bag. Plenty to wrap around as a cover. Due to the number of items needed to take to a shelter; I really appreciated the product being lightweight and easy to carry with the way the case was made.
customer_reviews.author: Q

customer_reviews.title: Keeping it Real!!!
customer_reviews.text: I used it first night I received. Camped out in uninsulated van in 40 F degrees, thinking it wouldn't be much of a challenge. I wore beanie, Jeans, socks, tee & 1 long sleeve shirt. I weigh 175 lbs & 5' 10". Leg room was good but shoulder room was tight. It took a lot of effort for me to zip it up all the way. You won't freeze to death I believe, but you won't be comfortable either. But it is only $35 & is very compact & light weight. If anyone knows of a better sleeping bag at this price point, please let me know ASAP. Keeping it Real!!!
customer_reviews.author: Dwayne jones

customer_reviews.title: Not warm enough for outdoor use
customer_reviews.text: I don't recommend this for outdoor use. I'm a small woman, and I used this indoors (heat wasn't on but it was probably 55°) and had on long sleeves and long pants as well and had a liner between me and the bag, and I had the bag zipped all the way up, and then I was warm enough. I had short sleeves on the first night and I was cold! I don't think I'd be warm if I had camped outdoors with this in the summer. I've used my friend's 20° Coleman sleeping bag outdoors on 45° nights and that kept me warm, so I did not think I would have an issue sleeping indoors.
customer_reviews.author: Amzn Custmr

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy
customer_reviews.text: I'm 5ft 6 inches and weigh 180lbs. This bag was too small. If you want to lay straight with no room to move, this is the bag for you. It was hard to zip up because there's basically no extra room. The zipper also kept getting stuck on the inside fabric. It was not compact either. It was pretty big in the compression bag. I don't understand where all the good ratings came from. Don't trust them.
customer_reviews.author: MoneySpender

customer_reviews.title: Terrific Mid-Weight Sleeping Bag for the Money
customer_reviews.text: I had to wait before I got a chance to use this new sleeping bag, but now that I have I can say it was a great purchase. I took it on a four-day trip summer houseboat trip on a mountain lake where essentially we were sleeping in the open air on the water. The weather was hot during the day, cooler and clammy at night. This sleeping bag worked well because it kept me warm without feeling like I was sweating to death in too much material. I was comfortable, and I really like the extra hood section to accommodate a pillow. It folds up easily into the storage bag, and is lightweight.
customer_reviews.author: Chrysalis Queen

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this sleeping bag as a substitute to a more affordable bag (looking at you Sportsman’s). Got to try it out for the first time this last weekend and I’ve gotta say: super impressed! Temperature got down to abou 35 degrees at night and this sleeping bag kept me completely content throughout the night. I usually have to wear 6 extra layers with a normal sleeping bag. I was able to get away with wearing just a sweatshirt and sweat pants with this bag. Extremely comfortable too! Slept like a rock and I normally struggle on camping trips. 5/5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Austyn

customer_reviews.title: If you're camping you will NEED this!
customer_reviews.text: 12/1/18 I haven't tried it outside just yet but I DID lay in it and actually took a short nap w/my pillow,was able to cover my head so I can block the light,wicked cool water proof feature(for the outside ONLY,inside is NOT waterproof).I'm 6ft 250Lbs and had a bit of room left inside so with your normal outerwear on you will feel snug/comfy inside this sleeping bag.Can't wait for the rest of the year so I can try it out then too.
customer_reviews.author: GREEK

customer_reviews.title: Not adult sized
customer_reviews.text: Description claims this bag is meant for adults and is 29.5” wide. Measuring the bag I get 27” at the bottom and maybe 26” at the shoulders. I am a 6 ft guy and it is not possible to zip the bag around my shoulders. Fail.
customer_reviews.author: John W Stevens

customer_reviews.title: The picture looks like a rectangle but it is a cacoon type
customer_reviews.text: Item returned. The picture looks like a rectangle but it is a cacoon type. My grandson does not like this shape to sleep in.
customer_reviews.author: nanamkk

customer_reviews.title: Freezing in Yellowstone!
customer_reviews.text: I just used this bag in Yellowstone last weekend where the temperatures dipped into the low 40s at night. I slept in pants, a thermal shirt, a sweatshirt and regular socks and was cold enough that it woke me up several times and my hips hurts from the cold. This bag description says it is usable in the 20s, but this was definitely not true in my case.
customer_reviews.author: Colorado Mom

customer_reviews.title: I should have tried this out before taking it camping
customer_reviews.text: I am really disappointed in this bag. I was really excited to try it out. The material its made out is solid but probably a little thin as it barely kept me warm enough at 40 degrees. Definitely would not keep you warm at 20 degrees. I rarely camp when its that cold anyway so I would have kept it. The biggest problem with this bag is its zipper. It just opens too easily. Anytime I moved at all or changed sleeping positions the zipper would open. Not just a few inches but a third to a fourth the length of the bag. I was up all night trying to keep it zipped up to keep warm.
customer_reviews.author: MsquaredM

customer_reviews.title: Carry sack easily fits bag
customer_reviews.text: It should be a simple thing that sleeping bags easily fit back into the carry sack they come with, but it isn’t always. We have a few sleeping bags at home, and my son wasn’t able to roll them or stuff them on his own. That’s a problem because he’s going to camp with his class soon and he needed something he could manage without my help. He was able to put this sleeping bag back into the carry sack on its own.
customer_reviews.author: Rabidus Matris

customer_reviews.title: Great for summer camping
customer_reviews.text: Waited to post this until I had used it a few times. This is a great sleeping bag for regular use. It will not keep you warm in very cold temps but we tent camped where the temps were in the high 40s and low 50s at night and were comfortable all night. I am a Southern Californian and those night time temps are quite low for me, I slept with the sleeping bag covering my face! Great for summer camping. I did not have the patience to get it back in the bag it came in (never been able to do that with any sleeping bag) so I just rolled it up and held it with a bungee cord.
customer_reviews.author: trisha

customer_reviews.title: Garbage bag more like it
customer_reviews.text: We bought two of these last week for a scout camping trip. Supposedly a steal, best quality for the price. Hooey. Both bags with less than 6 nights GENTLE use have split seams. Firs bag split a seam after the 2nd night use. My son was literally sleeping on his bed with the other sleeping bag as a partial cover and it split. Two strikes, you are out.
customer_reviews.author: Snoopy

customer_reviews.title: Warm & toasty
customer_reviews.text: Great sleeping bag although not nearly as roomy as implied so if you sleep in any position other than straight you may need to pack a sheet, unzip the sleeping bag and use it as a blanket over you instead. Its really warm and toasty. I had a tough job rolling it up and getting it back into the its little bag, which is taking strain at the seams already after only one use.
customer_reviews.author: supersha

customer_reviews.title: It looks fine the zippers work and it seems waterproof just like ...
customer_reviews.text: I haven't actually used it but based on the packaging and taking it out to inspect it. It looks fine the zippers work and it seems waterproof just like it's described. The only negative thing is that there's a little drop off paint near the logo but I'm ok with that lol. I'll update this after next week when I actually use it.
customer_reviews.author: Isabella Barrera

customer_reviews.title: Seam came apart after one use
customer_reviews.text: Seam at the hood of the sleeping bag came apart after one night of use. Really disappointed in the product. Can this be replaced by the seller?
customer_reviews.author: PhillyGirl

customer_reviews.title: Gotta have this
customer_reviews.text: These sleeping bags worked really well! They are super warm when the temperature drops at night. The two best features are the rope at the opening where your face goes and the velcro tab at the end of the zipper. The rope keeps the cool air from seeping into the bag and the velcro tab keeps the zipper from unzipping once you are snuggled up. This sleeping bag was designed a true camper! Must buy!
customer_reviews.author: Opinions, everybody has one

customer_reviews.title: Warm but tight fit
customer_reviews.text: Used this in 50 degree weather and it kept me warm. My only complaint is that it is a very tight fit. When I zipped it up I only had a couple of inches of extra room. I toss and turn a lot so that was a negative. I unzipped the entire thing and used it as a blanket instead. While it did keep me warm, I had to keep waking up to fix when it slid off my body. This is a great sleeping bag if you're thin. I'm a size XL in women's clothing and this was a tight fit.
customer_reviews.author: Alcira

customer_reviews.title: Impossible to roll up sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: I definitely liked this sleeping bag. It is comfortable, not too hot, and great for my weekend camping trip. It is a great purchase for the price that I paid (~$30). I did find it to be really difficult to roll back up, however. There are no strings or straps to help tighten up the sleeping bag into a roll. Updated to one star as the item is too difficult to roll back into the bag. It takes me 15+ minutes of frustration as I try to stretch a non stretch bag around a poofy slippery rolled up sleeping bag. Terrible.
customer_reviews.author: Revere

customer_reviews.title: Ordered one - within a minute of opening up and looking at it, ordered second one - quality is that obvious.
customer_reviews.text: Need 2 single sleeping bags for an upcoming trip. Have an old bag, but needed one more and bought this. It arrived today - pulled it out and looked at it - and decided immediately to just order another one and dump the old bag. Obviously high quality, and great product.
customer_reviews.author: M. Fielder

customer_reviews.title: Just got the bag and it's fairly well constructed, ...
customer_reviews.text: Just got the bag and it's fairly well constructed, especially given the price. However, the bag is not 29.5" wide. Laying on the ground it is about 26" wide. If you really pull the top tight, it's about 28". Also, the bag is not 3lb. The weight, as stated on the carry bag, is 2kg, or 4.4 lbs. As indicated by someone else, the picture showing the size is deceptive, it's considerably larger. All in all, it won't fit my needs because it is too narrow and too heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: GARGANTUAN!!!
customer_reviews.text: This bag was HUGE!!!! The picture of it in some hand is totally inaccurate. I wanted it for a backpacking trip but I had to return it due to its size. It took up all of my backpack and was heavier than everything else. Solid for car camping but if you're carrying it all on your back it's not a good idea.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Keeps you very warm in cold weather
customer_reviews.text: It will keep you perfectly warm in cold weather. The only complaints I have is that it isn't very wide, so it can be a little uncomfortable if you need more space to sleep in, but it seems to have more space than most sleeping bags I've seen. Also, it is pretty difficult to roll up the sleeping bag and put it into the carrying bag they provide because it is a extremely tight fit.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Cartmanez

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money
customer_reviews.text: Good deal for the money. Some sketching stitching on it in places and you have to be careful zipping it up. Other than that my kiddos stayed nice and warm and were comfortable in the sleeping bags.
customer_reviews.author: Holly Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: It was certainly warm and I like the fact that it is water proof and long ...
customer_reviews.text: This bag was alright. It was certainly warm and I like the fact that it is water proof and long enough to fit my 6'2" body length... but like one of the other reviewers mentioned, this bag is too narrow. I was not able to zip up the bag when I was laying in it because of that fact, and I am not a very obese person (6'2" 215 lbs). So I just ended up sleeping on the floor of the tent as the sleeping bag would slip off unzipped and I used it primarily as a comforter. Good for the kids, maybe not so much for the adults. Contemplating sending it back.
customer_reviews.author: Brooks Hargreaves

customer_reviews.title: Nice and warm
customer_reviews.text: I used this bag on a trip this past spring. One night I slept over in my car at a rest area in Alabama. It was unusually cold, but this bag kept me toasty warm. When the temp dropped to around 20 however, I began to get cold. I use it on my bed as well for an extra layer. It gets too hot sometimes! Roomy and soft.
customer_reviews.author: Linda M. Wheeler

customer_reviews.title: This is a good sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: This is a good sleeping bag, very lightweight and keep your warm. The material is well made. It's roomy for one person only. The four star was give because I found the portable bag that included was a little struggle to put the sleeping bag in place. It would be nice if the bag opening hole was a little large, other than that this a good price for this sleeping bag.
customer_reviews.author: S. Ha

customer_reviews.title: Tapers off too tight.
customer_reviews.text: The top is wide, but it tapers off at the bottom making it difficult to move your feet around. Not enough room at the foot area.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanie Cava

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: this sleeping bag is awesome. its so soft and plush but still folds down pretty small. much lighter than my old one. i took it to timothy lake the temp got down to about 35F, felt more like 25 because i was next to a fast moving stream. the bag kept me warm all night. i highly recommend this bag to anyone. also i love the strap at the top of the zipper, i move around a lot in my sleep and the sipper stayed up the whole time.
customer_reviews.author: britney heupel

customer_reviews.title: Out did my expectations
customer_reviews.text: On opening and inspecting this sleeping bag, it out did my expectations as far as quality and design. It is light weight and compact and the nice stuff sack was a pleasant surprise. I am going to give it its field test in late October in the mountains of West Virginia where it may get a tad chilly. I will write back with another review after that.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Keegan

customer_reviews.title: Not a good sleeping bag for purchase
customer_reviews.text: A good sleeping bag on the first use. On the second use, the zipper broke and the corner pulled apart just an inch away from the corner. Poorly put together and I do not recommend this as a purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Sandoval

customer_reviews.title: but great for car camping
customer_reviews.text: Bought two for my little kiddos for a spur of the moment camping trip. These are VERY cozy and warm. In fact, in hot weather, they might even be too warm. I've even considered having my husband and I trade our sleeping bags w/ our kids b/c these are cozier and zip together. Probably too heavy/bulky for extended backpacking use, but great for car camping. Had no trouble getting back into stuff sack. Kids were delighted. (FYI - these aren't "kid" sleeping bags, they are full size... fine for even larger adults (Husband is 6'3")... I just purchased them for my own kiddos.)
customer_reviews.author: Katie Gruver

customer_reviews.title: Up to 185lbs
customer_reviews.text: I got two, one for my young son and one for my 6'1" 250lb husband. There was no indication in the product description that the bag is up to 185lbs and 5'11" it's great quality and just what we want, but hubby wont fir.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great bag for the slightly more than casual camper
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son since he has outgrown the youth bags. He loves it, especially the extra pocket for his head/pillow. I love that it is light, and he can roll it up on his own. The sack is well designed with the over-the-top straps keeping it from coming out. Fall is coming, so my son will have a chance to use it for real outside.
customer_reviews.author: John Pratt

customer_reviews.title: not wide enough
customer_reviews.text: It is definitely long enough BUT NOT wide enough. Feel like I am wrapped in a papoose. Also, Amazon say's it's a 5 degree bag and the wrapper on the bag says -20. Quite a difference mm hmmm?
customer_reviews.author: Troy Bourne

customer_reviews.title: Great sleeping bag but very small.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little sleeping bag. Value for the price is great. However, I gave it to a young friend because it won’t go around my shoulders. It really should be marked as a children’s sleeping bag.
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda P.

customer_reviews.title: Great bag for the price!
customer_reviews.text: We just used our sleeping bags on a camp trip to Utah for spring break. The fabric was nice and comfortable and we kept warm with long johns and hats in our bags with lows of 36 to 45 degrees. The zippers worked well and we liked that our pillow stayed in place nicely. I tend to sleep balled up and realize now that a slighter wider bag would be better for me. I am 5 and a half ft tall and 130lbs. Overall, I was very satisfied with our purchase and was happy that we slept well and kept comfy/warm! My 10 yrs old wants to sleep in it at home now!
customer_reviews.author: Mary E

customer_reviews.title: Not as comfortable as advertised!
customer_reviews.text: This sleeping bag isn’t comfortable at all. Some of the other reviews said it was and I guess comfort varies from person to person, but this bag had me tossing and turning all night long. I barely slept 5 hours and woke up with my back aching. Don’t think I’ll be using it anymore
customer_reviews.author: Ramzi

customer_reviews.title: fine bag for sleeping and warmth
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 of these as I have twin grandsons. We went 3 nights backpacked into the wilderness, fine bag for sleeping and warmth, upon return removed both and washed on light, dried on light, one came through it perfect, one lost a portion of the zipper guide and will not function for further use. Things happen of course, but they were handled with respect and yet one failed. I am re-ordering the same to replace what has failed, only because I am dealing with twins and want them to be the same. (they are 10)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I bought this for my son for Christmas. He ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son for Christmas. He used it for the first time this weekend for his first boy scouts camping trip. The zipper broke the first night and the other one never worked.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: NOT for cold temperatures as advertised
customer_reviews.text: This bag did not keep me warm when the temperature dipped to 35 degrees F during a camping trip. This was despite the fact that I wore thermal pants and a shirt, extra sweatpants, 3 pairs of socks, a hooded sweatshirt, two pairs of gloves, a hat and a North Face jacket. My bag was atop a thermal sleeping pad and I even put an extra blanket over my head and body. Although this bag is soft and comfortable, it is not ideal for cold temperatures as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Keyania

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: Nice quality for the price. I didn't purchase this for camping but I needed something light weight and easy to take with me to hotels. I have bilateral hip bursitis and the beds are so hard in the hotels which irritated the bursitis. I will be taking on a trip soon and will get back with the results. Also I did wash and dry this at home and it came out perfect! Lori S. New Brighton MN
customer_reviews.author: Lori S.

customer_reviews.title: Way too big, compression sack does nothing.
customer_reviews.text: Sleeping bag is comfortable, but MASSIVE. It does not match the photo at all, and is very misleading. When it is in the compression sack uncompressed, it is the size of a large watermelon. Fully compressed, it is the size and shape of a basketball. It does not compress nicely at all. It would make a decent car camping sleeping bag, but not good for a hiking bag. Probably going to return it for anything smaller.
customer_reviews.author: Tressa

customer_reviews.title: Zipper Problems
customer_reviews.text: The zipper is not strong enough and split open when turning during sleep. I returned the product.
customer_reviews.author: Blue Eagle

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy this sleeping bag. It's rated for 20 degrees, but was struggling at keeping me warm at 40 degree. I'm a thick heavy set guy who works outside in the cold and this thing wasn't even able to keep me comfortable. Its small too. Couldn't get my shoulders inside the bag and zip it up. Had to go to a thrift store and buy another sleeping bag for 6 bucks. Turns out that cheap, no brand sleeping bag was both warmer and larger then this one. Definitely would not recommend to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Panda

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I bought these sleeping bags for my little boys for christmas hoping they would be good to use for our summer camping trips, but after only a couple months of once in awhile sleeping on the floor at home, because it's still winter, they have ripped on a few of the important seams. I'm really disappointed that by the time it comes time to really use them they are going to look like they've had years of heavy use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 20 degree bag? Dangerously misleading.
customer_reviews.text: I live outdoors. I have a comparably priced 20-degree bag, it is good down to about 26. Your bag I had for safety backup, thank goodness I tried it first. It is good down to maybe 36 degrees. It may be a decent 3 season bag, it is not a four-season bag or a 20-degree bag. You should change your description before someone gets hurt.
customer_reviews.author: Loving

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight, easy to fold and unfold, stuffs back into its bag easily. is comfortable to sleep in except narrow. I feel like it is more of a child's sleeping bag than an adult and I am only 5'4'. Love the color and the material just wish it were a little more generous with the leg room
customer_reviews.author: Georgie

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Loved the new sleeping bag it is lightweight but warm and durable. I am taking 1 star off because it does not have strings or straps on the sleeping bag itself, which would have made it easier to keep the bag from unrolling while packing the bag. Also the bag is narrower than other sleeepimg bag. So if you are heavy set, you may find the bag too snug or tight
customer_reviews.author: A. Bajaj

customer_reviews.title: Needed but didn't get to use.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this particular sleeping bag because of the good reviews. My grandson needed for Summer Camp, but, turns out he didn't use because of weather. However, I will say the sleeping appeared to be of good quality fabric and construction. However, I found the zipper gets stuck easily because of the fluffy fabric/lining. . Once it's out of case, there is no putting it back in. We rolled it up and put bungee cords around it to carry.
customer_reviews.author: Hope

customer_reviews.title: im 5'10" and its a little small for me
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a new replacement for camping. I unrolled it in the living room and got inside to see how roomy it is. well, its not roomy at all. the length is too short for me. I can't return it because its been too long so now im stuck with a bag I cannot use
customer_reviews.author: Hotpockitrockit

customer_reviews.title: I'm happy, and those who receive their new
customer_reviews.text: I'm buying sleeping bags for our local homeless. If I buy 10 through Abco Tech, I get a discount! They also arrive within 2 days! I'm happy, and those who receive their new, quality, lightweight sleeping bags are happy. Thank you to Abco Tech!
customer_reviews.author: Jane Beach

customer_reviews.title: It's not super wide, but I'm 5'7 140lbs and fit just ...
customer_reviews.text: I used this sleeping bag in North Cascades National Park and throughout a few Canadian National and Provincial Parks this summer where it got down to 35 at the coldest and 50ish at the warmest.While on colder nights, I was of course dressed for colder weather - sweatshirt, sweatpants - this bag worked for all temperatures. It's not super wide, but I'm 5'7 140lbs and fit just fine - I couldn't like put my one knee up all the way, but it's lightweight and portable for a reason. Only thing I had issues with was trying to get it back down to the size it came, but that's pretty typical haha. Can't beat the price either. Definitely would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Ansmn

customer_reviews.title: great feel, great features
customer_reviews.text: This was a good sleeping bag on two recent cool weather (35-45 F) trips. Packs well into small space with cinches to get it even smaller. Great zipper, easy pull. Velcro tab at top of zipper smart idea. Another Velcro tab about 8-12 inches lower would be a good feature to add. I am 215 pds, 5'11" and found this a bit snug. Long enough but little for me to close the bag. I am going to go find an Abco in a bigger size.
customer_reviews.author: James E Healy

customer_reviews.title: Fair bag. Better value alternatives out there.
customer_reviews.text: The quality seemed fair as some of the stitching had already undone before I even got it out of the bag. It also had a terrible smell like it has been in storage for a long time and moisture and/or moth balls got to it. It was also smaller than I thought it would be. It was fine for my body at 200lbs, but my 230lb wife struggled to zip up. Also, I heavily doubt this product would be any good at 20 degree temps as I was freezing the whole time even though it was only about 45 degrees outside
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: it is far better than Abco sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: I have a 5# Sierra Design mummy bag bought in 1970 and has more duct tape then rip stop nylon....yet... it is far better than Abco sleeping bag. But... what should one expect for the price? I am not ready to give up goose down for the new technology value priced sleeping bags. I give this bag two stars because I don't want to admit my error.
customer_reviews.author: beachman

customer_reviews.title: Fairly Warm
customer_reviews.text: So far I have used this more like a comforter than a sleeping bag all zipped up. But it has kept me nice and warm in temps in the 30s. Very light by weight so easy to carry. Rolls up rather easily to go back in the sack. Overall nice purchase, can't complain.
customer_reviews.author: TRM

customer_reviews.title: Okay for kids
customer_reviews.text: I liked this bag but it was way too small. It would be perfect for kids but if you’re at all claustrophobic or even if you just like space to roll without turning the whole sleeping bag with you I would keep looking. Also it opens on the right side which bugged me for some reason
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: ok for the money
customer_reviews.text: This bag has been ok for the money. Depending on what you want to use it for. I've taken it on several camping trips and it does the job. Although if it gets to be close to 30 degrees you better get a liner or wear a down jacked and double layer your socks. I did and froze that night. But for car camping in pleasant weather, I guess its good. Doesn't pack real small so its bulky for backpacking
customer_reviews.author: J. England

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: Traps body heat a little too well, the surface is rugged, and with a decent interior. It's pretty good. The bag, however, has some integrity issues: The grey/gray straps are poorly sewn at the ends, poorly built, and isn't practical without a clipping system. Basically, it's going to fall apart after a number of uses. But for the whole set at approximately 30 USD, it's definitely a good budget product. Only if you don't mind the troubles of the flimsy adjustable straps.
customer_reviews.author: Carbon 60

customer_reviews.title: It's amazing how resilient the little ones are
customer_reviews.text: Kids stayed warm and cozy during our summer camping trip. It's amazing how resilient the little ones are, sleeping so soundly on a hard surface! :) Backpack was great. Bring a small pillow to fit into the head part of the backpack and it will make it that much more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: ALC

customer_reviews.title: I'd buy again
customer_reviews.text: Good reasonably priced sleeping bag. Construction seems good. I will try it out in colder temperatures. I wanted a simple non-down bag. I wanted an insulation that you could throw into a washing machine and not need special down detergent and handling. I'm not sure what it would be like in freezing temperatures.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Happy With My Sleeping Bag?
customer_reviews.text: Haven't taken my sleeping bag to the wild yet but it looks and feels like I made the right choice! Promise to follow-up after I've experimented fully. Plan to sleep in van (locks on doors) and plan to use my hammock outside during the daylight hours with my sleeping bag for warmth. Going to Big Sur in October. Can't wait...need the rest.
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn

customer_reviews.title: Happy purchaser!
customer_reviews.text: Full disclosure - my sleeping bag won't be put to the full test until this September when I'll be going camping in conditions that will test cold conditions, but so far...Love it. It's very light weight so easy to carry, and very comfortable. Looks like it will hold up well too. It arrived as promised and I'm very glad I chose this one. I did a good bit of research first to find the right item for the right price. Great value here!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable and great quality.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in a combo with a sleeping pad and I slept on the floor with these two products for a week and I have nothing bad to say about either product. The sleeping bag is made for taller people and has good room inside, I'm 6'2 265lbs and I fit fine inside. Very comfortable, warm and good quality material, I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Slay

customer_reviews.title: Birthday gift
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as birthday gift for my son. Was concerned that it would be too large for backpacking, but the compression sack makes it small enough to not be too bulky. He is very happy with it, but has not had a chance to actually use yet so this is the reason for the 4 star rating.
customer_reviews.author: Lottie A. McNicol

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and gets the job done!
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased this sleeping bag while I was shopping around for something that would keep me warm in the sierras during a backpacking trip. I didn't have much to spend on an expensive fancy sleeping back but found this bag and decided to give it a try. Boy was I impressed! It will keep you pretty warm and is of good quality and folds up nicely into the compressed sack that it comes with. For the price there really isn't a better bag. Don't expect it to keep you nice and warm in snow but if the weather is cold and you're looking for an affordable and good quality bag, think no more!
customer_reviews.author: Mikhail

customer_reviews.title: The handle/strap system on the bag makes it easy to carry
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 5 year old son, so I've never tried it out myself. We took it camping where one night it got down to 26 degrees. He slept fairly well in it, although he told me that he got a little cold during the night. I think that it was probably due to the fact that it's an adult size sleeping bag, and he simply didn't have enough body mass within the bag to keep it warm. The handle/strap system on the bag makes it easy to carry, and it stores easily.
customer_reviews.author: L. Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Affordable quality!
customer_reviews.text: Love this sleeping bag. The material feels great against my skin. I camped out for a few days and the nights got down to 29 degrees. I stayed comfortable and warm the entire night. I' a bigger guy and didn't do the math on the dimensions of the bag, so I was a little snug all night. But I can't blame the bag or the company for that. This bag performed as stated in the description. I also have to two person version of this bag and that's what made me buy the single. I would recommend these bags to anyone looking for an affordable, but still quality bag.
customer_reviews.author: Michael C.

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable sleeping back that was easy to get back in its carrying case.
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with the sleeping bag. We took it camping this weekend and used it in low 50 degree outside weather. The bag is comfortable to sleep in and would be a good choice for people who toss and turn because you don't get bound up in it. The carry case is a neat design, having a strap on each side to grab it made it convenient to pack and carry. The zipper is a good design that makes it easy to open and close without getting it stuck. Seller was very good to deal with, fast shipping and great communication. I would by from Abco Tech again.
customer_reviews.author: James Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service
customer_reviews.text: Great customer service! My daughter used it for the first time at a sleepover last night. She told me it is big and she will be able to grow into it-she is almost 10 and is 4'9". Very warm and has enough thickness to have slept very comfortably on the floor of a basement. Easy to roll and had a friend put it in the bag easily. Great price too! We would recommend highly!
customer_reviews.author: Mary Anne DiVito

customer_reviews.title: I purchased the ABCO sleeping bag for my granddaughter who ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the ABCO sleeping bag for my granddaughter who is a camp counsellor again this year. It fits her needs perfectly. She is a is 5'8"and loves the sleeping bag because it is roomy, lightweight yet keeps her warm. She also says that it is perfectly long enough for a tall girl and that she would recommend the Abco sleeping bag to anyone. A fine product for anyone who is a serious camper.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Temples

customer_reviews.title: He said it was very comfortable but had a difficult time getting out of the ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 11 year old for "camping" trip (in a cabin). He said it was very comfortable but had a difficult time getting out of the bag. While trying to get it out, the straps around the outside ripped. He also couldn't get it back in, but I think that has more to do with the user than the sleeping bag. For the price, it's a decent sleeping bag.
customer_reviews.author: ECMOM

customer_reviews.title: Nice bag---lightweight. A bit narrow for a big guy
customer_reviews.text: Nice bag---lightweight. A bit narrow for a big guy. Used it about 8200 ft at about 27 degrees. Whatever good merits this bag has, they've ruined it by using a ten cent zipper. It jams, unzipps easily (when you don't want it too, like the middle of the freezing night). The second use, the cheap zipper just locked up and refused to do anything. I finally had to pry it apart and use it like a blanket and froze all night.
customer_reviews.author: K. Sands

customer_reviews.title: Perfect budget sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: I've used it for my Yosemite 4-day camping, Channel Island 1-night backpacking around 30F, and Havasupai 2-night backpacking around 10F. It's comfortable for 30F and definitely you need liner for 10F. The quality is good enough for camping or backpacking enough. Given the price, it's worth 5-star!
customer_reviews.author: Yu-Keng Shih

customer_reviews.title: Tight across the chest
customer_reviews.text: Nice bag but not for me. I'm 6'1" 250lbs with 48 inch chest. the length is okay but it narrows at the chest area. It would be okay if I didn't have arms. Those pesky arms get in the way. I'll keep it for smaller members of my family but I would bust the zipper if I fell asleep in it.
customer_reviews.author: Weaselbroom

customer_reviews.title: Warm, Spacious and Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Very warm, comfortable and spacious sleeping bag. Also, very lightweight...No carrying issues for my 11yo kid. For the price, totally impressed!!! Now, if I can only figure out how to get it back in the bag like how it came so nicely packed! :-)
customer_reviews.author: Annie515GW

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: This sleeping bag does the job. I just used it this past weekend in Northern Minnesota where it got down to upper 30s for a low and it kept me warm all night long. The little carrying bag is a nice fit and it is very lightweight.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Great sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: Great sleeping bag, comfy and warm. I’m using this sleeping bag for sleeping on the floor of my friends’ places during a road trip. So far the sleeping bag has proved invaluable. For its price, the sleeping bag works really well.
customer_reviews.author: Tran Hung

customer_reviews.title: Great bag for the price
customer_reviews.text: I've tested this down to 46 degrees thus far and stayed warm. Also got rained on while hammock camping in it and stayed dry inside. Only thing to be aware of with this bag is that it's only 30 inches wide so it can get snug around the shoulders when zipped but granted that's just a personal preference. It will also fit well into a backpacking backpack. No regrets with this one for a cheaper bag that performs well.
customer_reviews.author: Christinna Swearingen

product_meta.title: Sleeping Bag – Envelope Lightweight Portable, Waterproof, Comfort with Compression Sack - Great for 4 Season Traveling, Camping, Hiking, Outdoor Activities & Boys. (Single) by Abco Tech
feature_bullets: ULTRA COMFORTABLE SLEEPING BAG – Abco sleeping bags are designed to ensure that after a tiring day of trekking, hiking, travel or any other exploration you can get a good and relaxing night’s sleep. The bags have barrel shaped design which is wide at the shoulders and narrow at the leg’s end to offer maximum comfort, warmth and freedom.

DESIGNED FOR EXTREME WEATHERS – Our sleeping bags are designed for near-freezing temperatures and have a rating of 20 degrees Fahrenheit – meaning these are designed to keep the average sleeper warm even at 20F. Moreover, these bags also have a waterproof, weather-resistant design to keep you warm even in extreme conditions and prevent you from any dampness - this is achieved through double-filled technology and S-shaped quilted design.

EASY TO CLEAN AND CARRY – Our sleeping bags are also extremely easy to clean as they are safer for machine wash too. Moreover, each sleeping bag comes with a travel-friendly carry bag, a compression sack with straps, which makes it quite convenient to store and carry the sleeping bag along. The bags are not only ideal for cold conditions but even for warmer weather.

LIGHTWEIGHT, SKIN-FRIENDLY AND DURABLE – The sleeping bag offers you extra comfort during Adventurous activities but without adding any extra pounds to your backpack like a foam pad. It has 100% polyester lining which is skin-friendly and uses high quality 210T polyester on the outer side to offer durability to the sleeping bag. The high-quality precisely done stitches enhance the durability even further.

100% RISK-FREE SATISFACTION GUARANTEE – We also offer you 100% risk-free satisfaction guarantee to let you buy with confidence; no questions asked. However, we are quite sure that this sleeping bag would bring enormous comfort during your rough and adventurous rides, camping, hiking, or long term travel, while also making it extremely convenient to carry along.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
